column1: Once upon a time in the middle of winter
column2: when the flakes of snow were falling like feathers from the clouds
column3: a Queen sat at her palace window
column4: which had an ebony black frame
column5: stitching her husband's shirts. While she was thus engaged and looking out at the snow she pricked her finger
column6: and three drops of blood fell upon the snow. Now the red looked so well upon the white that she thought to herself
column8: that I had a child as white as this snow
column10: and as black as the wood of this frame!" Soon afterwards a little daughter came to her
column11: who was as white as snow
column12: and with cheeks as red as blood
column13: and with hair as black as ebony
column14: and from this she was named "Snow-White." And at the same time her mother died.
